main event: On August 19, 1948, an unidentified flying object was reported at Godman Air Force Base, Kentucky. It was estimated to be spherical in shape, bright silver in color, giving a reflection from the sun at an altitude of 30,000 to 40,000 feet. An F-51 was dispatched to observe the object, and subsequent reports confirmed that it was Venus.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be at an altitude of approximately 30,000 to 40,000 feet and was spherical in shape with a bright silver color reflecting the sun.
An F-51 was dispatched from Standiford AFB, Kentucky, to observe the object.
There were azimuth and elevation readings taken by theodolite every minute, and the progress of the object was being charted.
It was later ascertained by an astrologer that the unidentified object was in fact the planet Venus.
The report mentions previous incidents of unidentified aerial objects, many of which were evaluated as astronomical or non-astronomical with various probabilities and explanations.
result: Unidentified flying object identified as the planet Venus
sighted object: Unidentified flying object resembling a bright spherical object reflecting sunlight
witnesses: Lt. Colonel, Executive Officer, and other Air Force personnel
photographs: No photographs included in the report
